1.text: Pry open the bottle with the edge of a spoon.

2.text: Use a pair of scissors as a makeshift bottle opener.
2.vid: /0/04/Open a Bottle Without a Bottle Opener Step 2 Version 6.360p.mp4

3.text: Pop the cap off the bottle using a hammer.
3.vid: /0/08/Open a Bottle Without a Bottle Opener Step 3 Version 6.360p.mp4

4.text: Try twisting the cap off with a rubber band or cloth.
4.vid: /a/a0/Open a Bottle Without a Bottle Opener Step 4 Version 6.360p.mp4

5.text: Place the bottle cap against your countertop to knock the cap off.
5.vid: /6/6b/Open a Bottle Without a Bottle Opener Step 5 Version 3.360p.mp4

6.text: Loosen the cap with your keys until it falls off.
6.vid: /6/67/Open a Bottle Without a Bottle Opener Step 6 Version 5.360p.mp4

7.text: Position a lighter underneath the cap until it pops off.
7.vid: /f/f3/Open a Bottle Without a Bottle Opener Step 7 Version 2.360p.mp4

8.text: Use the edge of a belt buckle to simulate a bottle opener.
8.vid: /f/fc/Open a Bottle Without a Bottle Opener Step 8 Version 6.360p.mp4

9.text: Pry the bottle cap off with a steel or titanium ring.
9.vid: /1/1a/Open a Bottle Without a Bottle Opener Step 9 Version 6.360p.mp4

10.text: Turn a screw into the cork and pry it out with a hammer for a makeshift opener.

11.text: Place the bottle in a tennis shoe and hit it against a wall if you don’t have tools.
11.vid: /2/20/Open a Bottle Without a Bottle Opener Step 11 Version 6.360p.mp4

12.text: Use a bike pump to force the cork out of the bottle.

13.text: Push the cork into the wine bottle if you can’t get it out.
13.vid: /8/8a/Open a Bottle Without a Bottle Opener Step 13 Version 6.360p.mp4
